DOC.HEADLINE: WORLD IN BRIEF ; ISRAEL ; JAILED MAN KEEPS HIS WORD UNTIL THE END
DOC.TEXT: An Israeli jailed since 1962 for refusing to agree to a divorce has died at 81 , keeping a vow to keep his estranged wife married to him until his last breath , the prison service said . Yihya Avraham , who married his wife Ora , 66 , in Yemen when she was 12 years old , died Sunday , a week after suffering a cerebral hemorrhage.Avraham and his wife had been separated for 41 years . Over the years , Avraham was offered blessings from prominent rabbis , lodging_in an expensive retirement home and his freedom if he would say just three words . Under Jewish law a husband may be held_in prison until he complies with a rabbinical court ' s order to grant his wife a divorce . To be freed he must declare : " I am willing. "
